result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Anthony A Collins was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony A Collins in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Anthony A Collins in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Doctor report states that defendant is incompetent but could be restored to competency.
State req that Court find defendant not competent, but ordered into competency restoration program.
Defense agrees.
BTC:  Finding that defendant is not competent to proceed.  Finding that it is likely that defendant will regain competency within the next year.  Defendant is ordered into the Competency Restoration Program.  Defendant is not competent to refuse medication/treatment.  Proceedings are suspended.  Defendant is committed to the DHS.  Defendant's appearance is waived at next hearing if competency is not restored.  Review hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
